poem:
Title: "The Fragile Anchors of Democracy"

Dividend of strife, on Soweto's plain,
Soot and freedom borne, the ANC soul wanes, 
The heart of our nation, betrayed by pain,
A charter's echo in eroding reign.  

Charred remnants whisper,
"to all who arrive herein"
Dash not the dreams,
That birthed rights in this wind-swirled terrain. 

Pledge to the soil, our republic again,
South Africa, the basket cradle of men.
